calc_intro: You want to do your apprenticeship part-time. This calculator helps you. It shows how long it will take.
info_fulltime_hours: Enter the weekly hours from your contract. Usually 38 to 40 hours.
info_parttime_hours: Enter how many hours per week you want to work.
label_training_duration: Duration of the training in full-time
info_training_duration: Choose the normal duration in months.
option_parttime_later: I start full-time and switch later
info_parttime_start: Enter the months you are full-time. Write 0 if you start part-time right away.
info_age: Some people over 21 can shorten the training.
info_school: A higher degree can save time.
question_experience: Do you already have relevant work experience?
info_experience: For example an internship or a job.
question_apprenticeship: Have you already completed an apprenticeship?
info_apprenticeship: A matching apprenticeship can save time.
question_study: Have you taken relevant courses at university?
question_childcare: Do you care for your own children?
info_childcare: This can be important for part-time.
question_familycare: Do you care for other people?
result_served_copy: These months you plan to work full-time first.
result_parttime_detail_extend: The training lasts several months longer.
result_early_body: Very good performance can shorten the training. Ask the competent body.

footer_about_text: This calculator helps with part-time training.
faq_intro: Here you find short answers about part-time training and shortening. For details see the link below.
faq_q1_body: Anyone can do part-time if the company agrees.
faq_q2_body: School is usually the same as full-time. Part-time mostly changes company hours.
faq_q3_body: Hours are agreed with the company. Often not more than 50% cut.
faq_q4_body: Less hours can make it longer. Example: 3 years regular → about 4 years at 75%.
faq_q5_body: Age over 21, school degree, work experience, caring duties can shorten. Total usually max 12 months.
faq_q6_body: There is a legal minimum (e.g. 3 years regular → at least 1.5 years).
faq_q7_body: With very good performance you can take the exam earlier (§45 BBiG). Ask the chamber.
faq_q8_body: Apply together with the company at IHK or HWK, best before the start.
faq_q9_body: Often possible. Apply with the company to the chamber.
faq_q10_body: School time is deducted. Remaining hours are spread for useful shifts.
faq_q11_body: Vacation depends on working days. Pay can be reduced with hours but not always.
faq_more_body: More details: Netzwerk Teilzeitausbildung Baden-Württemberg (external link).
faq_disclaimer: These tips do not replace official advice (IHK/HWK).
how_intro: This calculator shows how long your apprenticeship lasts in part-time and with shortening reasons. Here is how it works.
how_sources_body: Based on the Vocational Training Act (BBiG), especially §7a and §8.
how_sources_note: Sources: Federal Ministry of Justice and IHK Rhein-Neckar
how_basics_body: Different reasons can shorten the training. There are limits.
how_basics_tip: All reasons are added. Then caps are applied.
how_age_body: If you are over 21 at start: shorten 12 months.
how_experience_body: Relevant work or finished apprenticeship can shorten 12 months.
how_study_body: Relevant modules can shorten up to 12 months.
how_family_body: Care for own children or relatives counts: 12 months.
how_caps_intro: Two limits are checked. The stricter applies.
how_caps_card1_body1: Sum of reasons never more than 12 months.
how_caps_card2_body: Training must not go below the legal minimum.
how_parttime_body: Less hours can extend the duration.
how_parttime_rule2: Extensions up to 6 months are ignored.
how_steps_note_body2: Further shortening can be via early exam with good performance.
how_disclaimer: Results are a guide only. No legal claim. Final decision by the competent body.
pdf_footer_note: This is a guide. Not legal advice.
